document_data.name: Yatagan
document_data.mainbody:
Sheikh '''Yatagan''' was the leader of the [[Shremala]] tribe of [[Bedine]] during the mid–14{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Unless the witch sees some reason to wait, I will signal the others to start the attack.|Sheikh Yatagan, speaking to empty air.}}
document_data.Description:
The old sheikh had the visage of a wise elder, as shown by his wrinkled face and the fact he had no remaining teeth.

He dressed in vibrant colors that stood in stark contracts to the drab [[aba]]s worn by the sheikhs of other Bedine tribes, along with the heavy furs worn by the Shremala tribe.
document_data.History: Yatagan and the Shremala were among the Bedine tribes that banded together to drive the [[Zhentarim]] from their desert in the {{YearlinkName|1360}}.
